recommendations.name: Museo del Prado
recommendations.snippet: One of the finest art collections in the world and the best collection of classical art in Madrid.

images.caption: In the main exhibition hall, first floor
One of the main promenade entrances to the Prado is dominated by this bronze statue of Diego Velázquez.
The cafeteria in the underground extension by Rafael Moneo
The Goya Gate in the north façade of the museum.
Hieronymus Bosch, The Garden of Earthly Delights, between 1480 and 1505.
Diego Velázquez, Las Meninas, between 1656 and 1657.
Diego Velázquez, The Triumph of Bacchus, 1628–29

recommendations.name: Palacio Real
recommendations.snippet: The Palacio Real is an enormous palace, one of the biggest in Europe, with scorching plains of concrete around it.

images.caption: View of part of the Royal Palace from Cuesta de la Vega, by Fernando Brambila (c. 1790-1832). Preserved in the collection of the Ministry of Economy and Finance.
One of the entrances to the Palace.
Detail of the facade over the Prince's Gate. Reccared II and Liuva II, Visigoth kings, flanking the arms of Spain. The statues do not match the names on the bases.
View from the Plaza de la Armeria
Statues of the Gothic kings in the Plaza de Oriente.
View of Paseo Principal, part of Campo del Moro Gardens.

recommendations.name: Museo Thyssen-Bornemisza
recommendations.snippet: Contains a large art collection including masterpieces by Monet, Goya, Degas, Renoir, Van Gogh, Picasso, Mondrian, Bacon and Lichtenstein.

images.caption: Portrait of Giovanna Tornabuoni by Domenico Ghirlandaio, 1489-90
View of Vessenots, Auvers, by Vincent Van Gogh

recommendations.name: Museo Nacional Centro de Arte Reina Sofía
recommendations.snippet: Housed in a former public hospital with an adjacent modern wing, this museum contains Spain's largest collection of 20th century art.

images.caption: Close up of the front of the Reina Sofía in Madrid Spain.
Interior gallery photo inside the Reina Sofía Museum
Close up of the front of the Reina Sofía in Madrid Spain.
Interior gallery photo inside the Reina Sofía Museum

recommendations.name: Gran Vía
recommendations.snippet: Gran Vía (literally "Great Way") is an ornate and upscale shopping street located in central Madrid.

images.caption: Black & White photograph of Gran Vía (2011).

attribution.attribution_text: No machine-readable author provided. Mr. Tickle assumed (based on copyright claims).

images.owner: No machine-readable author provided. Mr. Tickle assumed (based on copyright claims).
images.caption: The Metropolis Building located in Gran Vía and Alcalá Street
Gran Vía, also called "The Spanish Broadway".

recommendations.name: Palacio de Cristal
recommendations.snippet: However, the building has remained on the original site, next to a lake, and has been restored to its original appearance.

recommendations.name: Plaza de Oriente
recommendations.snippet: Plaza de Oriente is a square in the historic centre of Madrid, Spain.

images.caption: Night view of the plaza, with the monument to Federico García Lorca in the foreground and the ME Madrid Reina Victoria in the background
The monument to Pedro Calderón de la Barca on the plaza (Joan Figueras Vila, 1878).

recommendations.name: Museo Nacional de Ciencias Naturales
recommendations.snippet: Contains a large collection of fossils and minerals, plus educational exhibits (some are described in English but many are in Spanish only).

images.caption: Section of Natural HistoryDiplodocus and other fossils
Section of Natural HistoryDiplodocus and other fossils

recommendations.name: CaixaForum Madrid
recommendations.snippet: A private centre particularly well-known for the "vertical garden" by Patrick Blanc installed on a wall in front of the museum, as well as the quite special architecture of the building itself.

images.caption: CaixaForum Madrid, constructed by Herzog & de Meuron, view of 2011.
Détail of the vertical garden in 2011.
Pierre de Wissant, one of The Burghers of Calais, by Auguste Rodin
Détail of the vertical garden in 2011.
